---
title: 'build'
description: "Compile an expression from a script into a reusable artifact"
---

Compile a Xorq expression from a Python script into a build artifact you can run or serve later. The artifact is a directory under `--builds-dir`; you pass that path to `xorq run` or serve commands.

## Usage

Point at a script and the name of the expression variable to build.

```bash
xorq build <script_path> -e <expr_name> [OPTIONS]
```

## Arguments

Positional and required arguments.

| Argument | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `script_path` | Path to the Python script that defines the expression |

## Options

Optional flags for output location and debugging.

| Option | Short | Default | Description |
|--------|-------|---------|-------------|
| `--expr-name` | `-e` | `expr` | Name of the expression variable in the script |
| `--builds-dir` | | `builds` | Directory where artifacts are written |
| `--cache-dir` | | (system cache) | Directory for parquet cache files |
| `--debug` | | | Emit SQL files and other debug artifacts |

## Example

Build the expression named `expr` from a script and write artifacts under `builds/`.

```bash
xorq build my_script.py -e expr --builds-dir builds
```

The command prints the build path (e.g. `builds/f02d28198715`) to stdout. Use that path with `xorq run` or `xorq serve-flight-udxf`.
